snippet.title: Play-offs hopes down to last game for Maroochydore
snippet.content: RUGBY UNION: Maroochydore's place inside the top three is still yet to be secured. The Swans suffered a heavy defeat at the hands of A-grade competition leaders Noosa on Saturday, going down 43-11. Despite the scoreline, Beakey said it was only a try spree in the dying stages of the game by a fresher Dolphins outfit that did the damage. "Noosa put on four or five tries in the last 15 minutes we just couldn't keep with them," coach Stu Beakey said. Beakey said a lack of players had forced his side to grind out a tough 80 minutes. "I wasn't unhappy with the way they played today. They were beaten in the end by a much better side," he said. Now, the Swans need to stave off University of the Sunshine Coast in the final regular-season fixture to finish in the finals-bound top three and progress to a semi-final against Caloundra. The Swans are four points clear of the Barbarians, which sits last on the four-team ladder. USC would need to confidently defeat the Swans and claim a bonus point to have any shot of leap-frogging into third. Although unlikely, Beakey said he would enter the upcoming match ready for anything. "It's all down to the last game," he said. "We beat them (USC) three times out of the four times we've played them but they are a much improved side and we certainly wouldn't be taking them for granted." Meanwhile, Caloundra donned vintage jerseys at home and defeated USC 29-17.
